events.title: Confederate General Robert E. Lee's Surrender at Appomattox Court House
events.description: General Robert E. Lee surrendered to Union General Ulysses S. Grant, effectively ending the American Civil War.
events.significance: Marked the end of the bloodiest conflict in American history and led to the preservation of the United States.

events.title: Germany Invades Denmark and Norway
events.description: Nazi Germany launched Operation Weser√ºbung, invading Denmark and Norway during World War II.
events.significance: Expanded German control in Europe and secured strategic access to resources and naval routes.

events.title: The First Super Bowl is Broadcast in Color
events.description: Super Bowl I, the championship game of the NFL, was televised in color for the first time.
events.significance: Marked a milestone in sports broadcasting, enhancing viewer experience and popularizing American football.

events.title: The Russian Tsar Nicholas II Abdicates
events.description: Czar Nicholas II of Russia abdicated the throne, leading to the eventual fall of the Romanov dynasty during the Russian Revolution.
events.significance: Signaled the collapse of imperial rule in Russia and paved the way for Bolshevik control.

events.title: Bataan Death March Begins
events.description: After the surrender of the Bataan Peninsula to Japanese forces in World War II, thousands of Filipino and American prisoners were forced to march under brutal conditions.
events.significance: An infamous atrocity highlighting the brutal treatment of prisoners of war, impacting Allied morale.
